Name: الرقة
loc: Early Islamic al-Raqqa; plan of al-Raqqa in EI2, "Rakka" (M. Meinecke).
Comments: No ʿAbbāsid coinage after 254 H; first gold issue from 279 H (Ṭūlūnid) (Diler, vol. I).

Name: كفرتوثا
location_certainty: confirmed remains from early Islamic times
id: Cornu: today known as Tall ʿArrada, but I could not find any references to a place of this name. It should be somewhere in this region as Ibn Hawqal describes it as being situated between Dara and Raʾs al-ʿAyn. See also EI2 ("Nasibin", Honigmann).
